DOC.HEAD: Bush Names Ecuadorian Ambassador, National Security Aide
DOC.TEXT: President Bush on Friday announced his selection of Paul C. Lambert, a New York City attorney, to be ambassador to Ecuador. If confirmed by the Senate, Lambert, 61, would succeed Richard Newton Holwill. Bush also announced the appointment of Timothy E. Deal, a career diplomat, as a national security aide in the White House. Deal has been in charge of international economic affairs at the State Department since March. Before then, Deal was a deputy U.S. representative to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development in Paris.
